intro: Peucedanum terebinthaceum var. aciculare, commonly known as the slender cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies and traditional herbal use.
